Key Arguments: The legislation threatens freedom of speech and democratic rights.
The government is given the power to define truth, which could lead to control and manipulation of information.
The bill creates a double standard by imposing restrictions on online platforms while giving the government and mainstream media a free pass.
The subjective definition of misinformation and disinformation by ACMA could lead to abuse of power and suppression of diverse opinions.
The bill could turn tech companies into tools of government censorship, stifling free speech.
The legislation promotes ideological conformity and suppresses dissenting voices, hindering independent thought.
Notable Quotes: The Bill grants the government the authority to define truth, allowing them to control and manipulate the flow of information.
The Bill effectively enables tech companies to become tools of government censorship, stifling free speech and undermining the open exchange of ideas.
I strongly urge the government to withdraw this Bill and uphold the fundamental rights of every Australian citizen as stated in the Universal Declaration of Human Rights.
